content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why the inner mitochondrial membrane has more embedded proteins of the electron transport chain than the outer mitochondrial membrane?

choices.label: The inner membrane is more efficient at capturing light than the outer membrane.
The inner membrane has a smaller surface area than the outer membrane.
The Krebs cycle occurs in the mitochondrial matrix and not the intermembrane space.
The outer membrane has a greater surface area for electron transfer.
